598469261.name: Nice place, ambitious owner
598469261.author: a TripAdvisor user
598469261.reviewBody: We had the pleasure of getting a private tour by the owner which made the experience unique for us. As we are not so involved in Mexican traditions and history this was very helpful for us.

address.streetAddress: Andador Ninos Heroes Esquina Morelos 4

569730292.name: 5 minutes or 2 hours... how good observer are you?! Awesome place
569730292.author: a TripAdvisor user
569730292.reviewBody:
Passion drives the way. Tere Cisneros runs this awesome place and she still welcomes the visitors warmly greeting everyone who wants to dive into the Mexican culture through the little dolls.
Pay special attention to the faces, the rich details in each scenario.
Definitely a must stop when visiting Tequisquiapan.
We loved it!

address.streetAddress: Andador Ninos Heroes Esquina Morelos 4

544346231.name: Fabulous place to show the everyday in Mexico
544346231.author: a TripAdvisor user
544346231.reviewBody: It was a beautiful museum that had to ny doll pieces of life in the Mexican suburbs and the Mexican traditions \nIt was an amazing way for foreigners to learn about Mexico

address.streetAddress: Andador Ninos Heroes Esquina Morelos 4

536844342.name: Amazing place!!!!
536844342.author: a TripAdvisor user
536844342.reviewBody: It\u2019s amazing place!!!! We(including my kids) love it so much!!! She made everything so detailed!!! And there\u2019re a place to play with traditional Mexico games!!!! For Adults :30 pesos, for kids : 20 pesos(under 3 years are free)

address.streetAddress: Andador Ninos Heroes Esquina Morelos 4

464997571.name: Enchanting!
464997571.author: a TripAdvisor user
464997571.reviewBody: A charming display of bygone days.  Each whimsical scene has been beautifly handcrafted.  The attention to detail is extraordinary!  A must see place.

address.streetAddress: Andador Ninos Heroes Esquina Morelos 4

439333748.name: Whimsical!
439333748.author: a TripAdvisor user
439333748.reviewBody: MUSEO M\u00c9XICO ME ENCANTA! Is a museum that depicts Mexican traditions via miniatures. The museum is curated by two lovely woman who re-create traditional scenes. The miniatures give us a brief and whimsical glimpse of several scenarios including but not limited to a posada, school yard, and even a tortilleria. The scenes are well orchestrated and capture the essence of life. The curators put a lot of detail into each scene\u2026the miniatures are lovely. I highly recommend that you visit the museum if you find yourself in Tequisquiapan. Of note, the museum is non-commercial...it is funded by the pure passion that resides within the curators.

address.streetAddress: Andador Ninos Heroes Esquina Morelos 4

260246896.name: Incredible work!
260246896.author: a TripAdvisor user
260246896.reviewBody: Please visit this non-comercial museum. The two women put a lot of work and effort and they need to be recognized for their efforts!

address.streetAddress: Andador Ninos Heroes Esquina Morelos 4

229002897.name: Mexico, me encanta!
229002897.author: a TripAdvisor user
229002897.reviewBody: Let\u00b4s say you love Mexico, let\u00b4s say you travel with kids, let\u00b4s say you do love miniatures, if so don\u00b4t miss the new miniature museum in central Mexico at Tequisquiapan, one hour drive from Queretaro. I had a great time touring the museum, with my family getting to know the history, traditions and celebrations of ancient and present Mexico. Everything in there for exhibition is kids scale, including the tiny chairs and tables at the restaurant! Enjoy the Museum next to the shopping around main square, not to mention the cheese & wine tours in and around Tequisquiapan.

address.streetAddress: Andador Ninos Heroes Esquina Morelos 4

629253553.name: A very beautiful downtown area in Tequisquiapan
629253553.author: a TripAdvisor user
629253553.reviewBody: Downtown Tequisquiapan is a fantastic place with lots of narrow streets embellished by colorful house facades. You can walk peacefully as there are several pedestrian streets and squares, and even streets open to traffic are quite pleasent as the pace is slow. There are lots of public gardens, restaurants of all types,hotels, art galleris, shops of handcrafts and places for wine and cheese tasting. Simply beautiful and inspiring.

566314406.name: A Fine and Peaceful Stroll
566314406.author: a TripAdvisor user
566314406.reviewBody: If all of Mexico was like the center of Tequisquiapan it would be a true Eden.  The area is sparkling clean with virtually no litter, there is hardly any traffic, there are many lovely old facades bedecked with flowers, the people are modest and friendly.  It is a place for artists and intellectuals.  Along with all the fine dining and artesenal shops an easy and peaceful place to while away a few days.

555721662.name: Clean and quaint
555721662.author: a TripAdvisor user
555721662.reviewBody: We walked around the main plaza, enjoyed the shops, and a breakfast at one of the restaurants to the side of the main church.  Then we walked around on the side streets and took the trolley car to see other parts of the town.  The streets are very quaint, clean and inviting.  It was mid-week and there were very few people around and all the shops we visited, the people were kind and inviting. As part of the trolley ride we stopped and tried some different wines and cheeses, which were excellent, and we bought some to take back with us.  Great visit.

550875616.name: Cute artisan village!
550875616.author: a TripAdvisor user
550875616.reviewBody: A small town that is worth visit. A place where you can easily walk through small narrow and beautiful streets. Amazing architecture with lots of \u201cbuganvilias\u201d that adorn each house. There are 2 indoor \u201cartesanias market\u201d with local food, handmade clothes, shoes and souvenirs with a very good price. A magical town to enjoy with family.

544814440.name: Beautiful little town
544814440.author: a TripAdvisor user
544814440.reviewBody: I went here knowing nothing and honestly just wanted to get back from Pena de Bernal to Queretaro. Boy was I wrong. This little town was a highlight. Every little street was interesting. Lots of little stores to browse and the cheese is amazing!

542622097.name: The title Pueblo Magico fits.
542622097.author: a TripAdvisor user
542622097.reviewBody: Love walking around the historical center of Tequisquiapan.  Many charming bouganvilla covered side streets with some cute shops with unique inventories and restaurants.  If you have kids with you, they\'ll love taking a ride on the little train that goes around the square.  People watching from one of the outdoor restaurants, or just a bench in the square, is a relaxing way to spend time.  Prepare to walk a block or two to get there, parking isn\'t convenient, but it\'s well worth the walk.

533546753.name: Variety, Fun, Interesting
533546753.author: a TripAdvisor user
533546753.reviewBody: We walked around the Center of Tequis for more than 3 hours on a Saturday late afternoon/early evening enjoying the shops, the sights and sounds.  There were many vendors and a lot going on to enjoy.  A great cultural experience.  We will come back again.

484019169.name: Cute artisan village with many handmade goods in the market
484019169.author: a TripAdvisor user
484019169.reviewBody: At the time of my visit, there were 3 indoor markets. Two were quite large and one was small but had two floor space. I loved the markets. They have local food (with 0 American influence), traditional snacks (corns, candied nuts and seeds, fruit juice), and even handmade shoes. I also enjoyed several galleries across from the Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion and bought one large painting. Price was excellent. Merchants are nice. They will let me try things but never pressured me to buy. Food at the restaurant (we tried the place that claims to have the best paella in the world) was good. The town is a great place to visit for a day if you are staying in Queretaro.

466050053.name: Centro Historico is Not Just the Square!
466050053.author: a TripAdvisor user
466050053.reviewBody: The charm of this small town is endless!  For an American who does not enjoy huge crowds and endless traffic, it is pure joy to see the colonial preservation of this area.  The area immediately adjacent to the main plaza is pedestrian only and blocked from vehicular traffic.  Where parking is available, it can be hard to find after 11 a.m.\nEasily walkable, the narrow cobblestone side streets are full of beautiful architecture and stunning flowering plants, trees and bushes.  Clean!  People very friendly with smiles and greetings appropriate to the time of the day.  Highly recommend exploring the small alleyways and calles that extend from the main plaza area.  Bring your camera if you love colonial architecture with eye-popping flowering shrubs.  Who needs to shop when there is so much beauty to experience in Tequis!  Yes!  A Magical Town for sure!!!  We have rented a home here for a year and are beginning the process to build a home and move from the USA.

653274981.name: Opal Mines near quaint Colonial Town
653274981.author: a TripAdvisor user
653274981.reviewBody: Great idea for a one day side trip if you are visiting that beautiful colonial town that is Tequsisquiapan, itself a comfortable 2 hour drive from Mexico City. You will spend a very interesting day visiting the mines and in the various shops. Most vendors appreciate if you do not settle for the quoted Price. Do try to go back and fort before acceding to the final Price. But do remember that local families depend on your business, and that prices, from the start, are very reasonable. Not much in the form of restaurants, but you can always pack a snack and return to Tequisquiapan for a leisurely lunch. Enjoy yourself!

640993550.name: Opal mines
640993550.author: a TripAdvisor user
640993550.reviewBody: We were two families which included two 6 year olds one 19 year old and one 3 year old.  We hired a driver  from Transportarte to take us from Mexico City to San Miguel Allende with a 3 hour stop I think at the opal mines.  $375.  They were awesome.   The ride in the back of a pick up truck was about 30 minutes and very bumpy but a fun experience and then we had I would say about an hour to find an opal. It was a fun experience. Then a half an hour ride back  It is a tiny little town but we were able to find a place to grab some food from lady cooking out of a small kitchen and we loved it.  You buy the tickets when you arrive with no problem.   And I think it was under $5 each.

615535815.name: Beautiful landscape, beautiful gems, great experience!
615535815.author: a TripAdvisor user
615535815.reviewBody: I visited the mine in May, we bought the tickets at the store (cheaper than booking it in the town) it\'s a nice house, the family that owns the mine is very gentle. They take you up in the mine, the landscape is just absolutely beautiful, the guide will give the group a very nice introduction about the history of the mine, how they work to extract the opals, the tools, and everything... After that, it is time to hunt opals! They provide the tools and the guide gives you an explanation on how to do it properly, even help you with the hunt. You allow keeping the gems you find, and if any of them are in the condition they will polishing for free to you! When the hunting is over the owner of the mine give you a full explanation about opals, the types, how they are formed... about the mine, the opals they find there, also he shows you the whole process of cutting and polishing the gems. I bought the one he used for the demonstration for a very good price! He does that for more than 60 years, he knows a lot about the subject and it is very nice see him working. You can also visit the shop, they have a very nice variety of the gems and jewelry to buy. I didn\'t know much about gems before the visit and now I love them! It was a lovely experience for us! really really recommend it!

611982632.name: Interesting Experience in Central Mexico
611982632.author: a TripAdvisor user
611982632.reviewBody:
I visited with some friends back in May.  While there are tours that can be arranged from nearby Tequisquiapan, if you have a rental car, it is better to drive.  The tours cost 350-450 Pesos (around 15-20 USD), but if you sign up at the store for the mine, its only 100 pesos (5 USD).   The shop itself is pretty expansive and has a lot of different products to shop for.  The prices are very good and the staff are very friendly.  If you can speak even a little Spanish, it can help you a lot.  I would recommend getting there earlier in the day, as it appeared to get very busy after 10 or 11am.

The mine itself is in beautiful location, and once you get to the mine, the guide will give a history of the mine, how to hunt for opals, and even do a demonstration of how the old miners worked the mine.  Again, Spanish is super helpful, since my guide didnt speak English.  After the info session, they give you a small pickax and around 30-40 min to hunt in a designated area.  I didnt find anything too fancy, but my friends managed to find some really good pieces.

After the mine visit, the owner will do a demonstration in the shop to show the process of cutting and polishing opals.  If you are even remotely interested in gems/minerals, this is a must visit in the area.

590599473.name: Mina Redentor
590599473.author: a TripAdvisor user
590599473.reviewBody:
My boyfriend and I found out about the opal mines from Foursquare while in Tequisquiapan and gambled our limited time in the area on a trip to the mines. This turned out to be the best decision we could’ve made! The ride up was rocky, it was fun like the upclimb of a roller coaster, and had breathtaking views. We came as a couple - I’m unsure if the tour we took required a minimum of four people, but another group of tourists quickly arrived and followed behind the tour truck in their own vehicle. 

The tour guide himself was expertly informed and very kind. There wasn’t a question about opals, rocks, or the surrounding landscapes that he couldn’t answer! We went to two mines and were very satisfied with the opals we found. It was an addictive experience and I’d want to return to the mines and spend more time searching in the future. 

Unfortunately we did not have the time to pair this experience with a wine and cheese tasting in Tequisquiapan, but showing up a little wine drunk and whacking things with a hammer is the only thing that I think could’ve added to this experience. Highly Reccomended!

575665418.name: Lovely Afternoon
575665418.author: a TripAdvisor user
575665418.reviewBody: This tour of the opal mine and the visit to the home of the family that works with and sells opals is very sweet. We first learned about the different types and properties of opal and got to see the polishing/shaping of the stone in action. Then we were led to a little family shop to purchase any finished items, but there was no pressure to buy. And finally, we took a relatively rocky ride up the mountain to the mine itself. Note that we were in the back of a canopied pick up truck (no seat belts) and traveling on unpaved or roughly paved roads for 15-20 minutes to reach the mine. The mine itself was really interesting. We searched for and found several rocks with opal, and our guide was diligent about finding more opal for us and teaching us how to cut the rock to get the opal out. If you bring the sunscreen and comfortable shoes and don\'t mind the ride up and back, this tour is definitely worth it!

571558463.name: If you find it you keep it
571558463.author: a TripAdvisor user
571558463.reviewBody: I went on a private tour with some friends. We had the oportunity to experince an explotion. And we got to keep whatever we found. It was a great experience.

510212683.name: Trip to Opal Mines (La Trinidad, near Tequisquiapan)
510212683.author: a TripAdvisor user
510212683.reviewBody: Takes about a ten-minute ride from Tequisquiapan to the town of La Trinidad which is the nearest town to the Opal Mine location. In La Trinidad, you\'ll find several small Opal stone stores. One of them offers a ride and tour to the mine site which is about another 10 minutes up a mountain. The abandoned mines offer great views, and the tour guide will tell you the entire history of the discovery, foundation, and exploitation of the mines. If you visit outside the weekend you may be able to enjoy the place just for yourself and company which will give you a sense of isolation, and a place for relaxation, meditation, and reflection. The tour guide will tell you that you can still find opals if you have the patience to dig and/or crack some of the rocks around you. I\'m sure he\'ll find one himself to motivate you to keep searching and make the trip worthwhile. Regardless of finding one, the views, the air, the colors, and the sense of peace and tranquility is worth the trip.

464999736.name: Breathtaking views!
464999736.author: a TripAdvisor user
464999736.reviewBody: A family run attraction.  Kindness and charm are their trademark.\nThe trip up the mountain is quite an experience! (be prepared for a rather bumpy ride).  The sweeping views from the top are breathtaking and you are able to keep any opals you find!

462236696.name: Was super excited about this, but beware minimum for tour!
462236696.author: a TripAdvisor user
462236696.reviewBody: The tour won\'t happen if there aren\'t four people signed up.  So if you\'re a couple or a single traveler, you might not get to do the tour.  Sucks to plan a visit to Tequis around this tour and then not be able to do it...

460041644.name: Find your own opals!
460041644.author: a TripAdvisor user
460041644.reviewBody: Learn while you listen, see and do.\nSee the shop, the store and the actual mines  Find out and practice how to cut a rock and find the opals. Fun.

435091007.name: Great Family Adventure
435091007.author: a TripAdvisor user
435091007.reviewBody: We visited the mines with our two daughters (8&10). We all enjoyed the adventure. They picked us up in twin and drove us up to the store to explain about the Opals and then off to the mines. We chose to start at the bottom which includes a short walk up to the mine. We found some interesting a pretty samples. Great service, very knowledgeable. No pressure to buy. The girls (the big one too) got to pick out a small polished opal to take home.

427067515.name: TEQUISQUIAPAN - one visit and you will remember the name forever!
427067515.author: a TripAdvisor user
427067515.reviewBody: Tequis is our new home - chosen over the entire country of Mexico.  So much positive to say about this valley - you will just have to visit!

395259615.name: Awesome experience! You can\'t miss it! Wear good snickers & bring a portable flashlight
395259615.author: a TripAdvisor user
395259615.reviewBody:
It has been the most wonderful experience I've had in Tequisquiapan! Highly recommendable that you include this visit in your activities to do while you are in Tequisquiapan. 

You arrive at the bottom of the mines then you have to change your car for one suitable to climb up the road to ge to the mine. The people who do this are very kind. We had the opportunity to sit beside the driver who would answer all of our curiosities and tell us stories regarding the mine.

The road up to the mine is a beautiful view thanks to the mountains and all the green vegetation that surrounds the way.

Once you arrive at the top, the view of the valley is even more impressive like a landscape perfectly created on a movie. Is picture time as you really would want to photograph that image.

The tour guide begins to speak about the mine, very interesting. Then he took us inside the mine, amazing!

Then is time for you to look for your opal! Is magnificent! Is fun, is a complete different and extraordinary experience.

You have to live it to feel it! Because it might seem a bit dull walking around rocks then having to use a hammer to discover something, but believe me is a great experience and you get to keep a unique type of souvenir you found by yourself!

A lady who works with opals, said to us that the Opal chooses the person. That sounds even more amazing when you think of the opals you found.

274997056.name: Opal Buff
274997056.author: a TripAdvisor user
274997056.reviewBody: The MOST exclusive thing is that hey may detonate a small explosive to let you break the pieces of rock with a hammer and find  your opal.

249052784.name: splendid
249052784.author: a TripAdvisor user
249052784.reviewBody: we spend a few hours looking for opals, my housband found one, and when we return to the shop the owner clean it an work the rock for us, I love to learn from the family the story about opal and the owner grandson show every thing that his grandpa has taught him a really interesting day.

218749750.name: Kids were fascinated....
218749750.author: a TripAdvisor user
218749750.reviewBody: This is a nice tour where you can actually visit a mine, and you can get you own opals from the stone... guide is just amanzing while explaining to everyone the process and  how a mine works... kids enjoyed a lot this tour

162461631.name: A Rocky Road
162461631.author: a TripAdvisor user
162461631.reviewBody: If you\'re into rocks this is a cool trip to do. You can also see the entire valley from the mine sites.

665034197.name: Fantastic experience
665034197.author: a TripAdvisor user
665034197.reviewBody: Toured the vineyard with my sisters and the experience was fantastic!   Ale was our host and she made the visit fun, informative and very enjoyable - she is very knowledgeable, makes sure you get answers to all your questions and that you have a great time.\nThe tour takes you from the plant to the barrel with a thorough and comprehensive explanation of the process. Then we tasted the wine (very good!) and went on to enjoy brick oven pizza AMAZING!!!!   All in all, our best experience of the trip

address.streetAddress: Antiguo camino a San Juan 357, San Jose de la Laja, Tequisquiapan

627217278.name: The best Vineyard experience in Queretaro
627217278.author: a TripAdvisor user
627217278.reviewBody: We love to visit vineyards all over Queretaro, and this is one of the best experiences ever! We look forward to staying in the hotel. It is so private and personal. A must visit!

address.streetAddress: Antiguo camino a San Juan 357, San Jose de la Laja, Tequisquiapan

596405575.name: Enjoy the pools in a safe place
596405575.author: a TripAdvisor user
596405575.reviewBody: There are many pools to enjoy with your kids, the place is safe and clean, but the food is no good the water of the pool is little cold

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Ezequiel Montes Km 10

396681642.name: Great for summer days!
396681642.author: a TripAdvisor user
396681642.reviewBody:
I visited this water park as part of a friends vacation with kids. The weather forecast wasn't so attractive as it said few sunny hours and a rain and it ended up in cold breezes and rain with less than 1 hour of sun.
I totally recommend to arrive early to the park as it is crowded during vacation days and many families visit this and other "balnearios" or water parks.
It is advertised as "aguas termales" or hot springs but to be honest, most of the pools were barely lukewarm. May be in hotter days the water would feel better.
As for the facilities, the water park is well equipped. It has different areas: green areas, grills, sledges, kids pool, wave pool, a fast food restaurant, mini super, kids playground and "palapas" or tables with a hut near the main pools.
You can rent sets of tables and chairs for $50 pesos and it will help you organize your food and belongings. 
There is, of course, restrooms and showers, a parking lot and many cool areas to sit with the family and friends.
It is a nice place, just check the weather forecast before going there.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Ezequiel Montes Km 10

665592937.name: Beautiful
665592937.author: a TripAdvisor user
665592937.reviewBody: This is the Church where my great great grandparents were married. It is a beautiful place with high ceilings. It was an honor to be there.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

566313509.name: Nice and Simple Cathedral
566313509.author: a TripAdvisor user
566313509.reviewBody: The conquerors of this land wrested enormous mineral fortunes from it, and constructed flamboyant edifices packed with wealth and precious stones, meanwhile enslaving the indigenous population and bankrupting Spain through inflation.  This church in keeping with the ambience of Tequisquiapan is modest and simple, the interior even a bit austere.  The facade is very pretty with simple lines and understated pastel colors.\nSitting in the plaza viewing it through the trees is a tranquil pleasure.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

505118118.name: Simple but beautiful
505118118.author: a TripAdvisor user
505118118.reviewBody: When you are ready to visit a true local scene near Mexico City, come to Tequisquiapan. Nice Plaza, great food, great shopping and an adorable little church.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

501018805.name: Brand new restoration. Lovely church
501018805.author: a TripAdvisor user
501018805.reviewBody: Very nice old church just restored. Located at the main downtown plaza. Great light inside. Very devotionally enviroment. Do not forget to get inside.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

500311158.name: Quiet church on the center square
500311158.author: a TripAdvisor user
500311158.reviewBody: This time the temple was deserted and quiet (previous visits have been extremely crowded). It was nice to wander through the building and view the pictures and dedications. The church bells ringing outside carried inside with amazing acoustical sound. I can only imagine a full choir in this space!

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

484019533.name: beautiful old church
484019533.author: a TripAdvisor user
484019533.reviewBody: This is a very old church. When you touch the wooden door in the front, you can feel its age. When we visited, there was a wedding. Strangers went up and congratulated the bride and the groom, and everyone was very friendly.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

466051953.name: Beautiful Small Church of Quiet Simplicity
466051953.author: a TripAdvisor user
466051953.reviewBody: Having seen many cathedrals and churches in Europe, Mexico and elsewhere, there is a quiet and simple elegance to the historic Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion.  Frequented by many locals, visitors here can enjoy moments in thankful contemplation and prayer.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

460457255.name: Peace and quiet
460457255.author: a TripAdvisor user
460457255.reviewBody: Spanish colonial simplicity and peace. Located in the main plaza. Next to it there are arts and crafts vendors on the weekends. All masses are in Spanish.\nThis Catholic church is really crowded on Sundays. For a visit, you find peace and quiet during the week.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

397105073.name: Beautiful, historic
397105073.author: a TripAdvisor user
397105073.reviewBody: Beautiful, historic old temple in the center of Tequisquiapan.  Be sure to stop by if you\'re in the area.  People wander in and out all day.

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

286715699.name: Awesome architecture, great views
286715699.author: a TripAdvisor user
286715699.reviewBody: To walk around and see the architecture of the buildings around gives you a pretty good idea of how it was in the old days. Great historical place

itemReviewed.name: Templo de Santa Maria de la Asuncion

address.streetAddress: Calle Salvador Michaus s/n

550255602.name: Lugar familiar!!!
550255602.author: a TripAdvisor user
550255602.reviewBody: Es un lugar para interactuar con los animalitos de la granja y pasar un rato divertido. Tambien lo que nos gusto es la cava de quesos!! Es un lugar mas que hacer en un fin de semana en TX

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 200 Km 50

485150998.name: Un lugar excelente para ni\u00f1os y adultos
485150998.author: a TripAdvisor user
485150998.reviewBody: El trato de los j\u00f3venes a cargo de este lugar es excelente, ama su trabajo y lodemuestraneneldetalle que ponen en atenderte, buscan que el lugar crezca y mejorarlo d\u00eda a d\u00eda.  Colaborando en su comunidad,realmente el paseo fue bastante agradable lo recomiendo mucho.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 200 Km 50

477415278.name: Un lugar diferente
477415278.author: a TripAdvisor user
477415278.reviewBody: Me gusto mucho la idea de llevar a mi hija a conocer animales de granja y creo que a ella le gusto mas. Es un lugar sencillo con diferentes especies de animales les puedes dar de comer, tocar y algunos montar, la explicaci\u00f3n es muy divertida y la comida muy rica

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 200 Km 50

458050831.name: Excelente lugar
458050831.author: a TripAdvisor user
458050831.reviewBody: Es un lugar bastante pintoresco con animales super nobles, la comida que venden en el lugar es riquisima, los propietarios te dan el tour personalmente, ampliamente recomendado para ni\u00f1os.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 200 Km 50

408003423.name: Bonito y divertido para los ni\u00f1os
408003423.author: a TripAdvisor user
408003423.reviewBody: Es peque\u00f1o el lugar y con pocos animales pero creo tienen raz\u00f3n en que si tuvieran mas animalitos el espacio no es el suficiente. Mi peque\u00f1a se divirti\u00f3 much\u00edsimo al verlos, alimentarlos y tocarlos. Lo \u00fanico es que la se\u00f1ora de la caja nos dec\u00eda que eran $75 por persona y en cartel al lado dec\u00eda $50, le pregunte el porque y me dice que es porque te dan un sombrero y si no quieres el sombrero son $50, as\u00ed que hay que estar atentos a lo que quieres o lo que te dicen al cobrarte. El recorrido y la explicaci\u00f3n por parte del joven que lo dio estuvo excelente, cada pregunta la respond\u00eda con gentileza y de forma muy animada y natural.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 200 Km 50

380105206.name: Esmero en la atencion
380105206.author: a TripAdvisor user
380105206.reviewBody: Lo mejor de Ranchito TX, es la atenci\u00f3n desde que te reciben hasta que te vas, los precios son razonables y est\u00e1 cerca nos gust\u00f3 ir a conocer  ;)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 200 Km 50

341080231.name: mi visita
341080231.author: a TripAdvisor user
341080231.reviewBody: la verdad no me gusto mucho, mis ni\u00f1as se emocionaron al principio pero despu\u00e9s se aburrieron y se quer\u00edan ir \nel entusiasmo les duro muy poco.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 200 Km 50

244701067.name: El mejor lugar para pasar un d\u00eda divertido en familia.
244701067.author: a TripAdvisor user
244701067.reviewBody: Si quieres tener un dia divertido en familia conviviendo con animales en una granjita didactica. Aprende a montar a caballo, come en ek delicioso resraurant, y los ni\u00f1os tendran un dia lleno de actividades divertidas las cuales les van a ayudar a desarrollar diferentes actividades

address.streetAddress: Carretera Estatal 200 Km 50

642242302.name: Relaxed Plaza & Musical Background
642242302.author: a TripAdvisor user
642242302.reviewBody: Main Plaza, main hobby seat on the bench enjoy the nice constructions and relax. Also art stores very attractive cost. You will find also cheese and beer bars and also local wine.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

629251141.name: A large and beautiful square in the heart of Tequisquiapan
629251141.author: a TripAdvisor user
629251141.reviewBody: The square is quite large amd there are lots of things to see and do. It has nice gardens and a fountain, a kiosk, a large church and corridors with large arches in three of its sides where many cafes, rsraurants, art galleries and hotels are located. The square is very lively with families, coupls and people of all ages. At night it is well illuminated and attracts lots of young people. It is very safe and the atmosphere of a small semi-rural town is delicious. Nearby pedestrian streets have lots of restaurants both formal and casual, as well as places where you can do wine and cheese tasting, listen to music or buy handcrafts. For small children there is a nice little rain that goes around.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

578358136.name: Charming and relaxed
578358136.author: a TripAdvisor user
578358136.reviewBody:
People we were visiting in Tula de Allende brought us here on our way to San Miguel de A.  The whole road we drove in on was decked out in bright paper "flags" strung between the tops of the buildings on both sides.  Festive indeed.

Beautiful plaza; bustling, interesting market with what seemed good quality crafts, and cheerful relaxed vendors.  Being the center of a fairly large pedestrian area gave the place sort of a fair or carnival atmosphere.

 We had to park a ways away in a treed lot near the river and as an added bonus we were able to show a stunning vermillion flycatcher to our hosts.  There is no seriouser red than vermillion.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

566312630.name: One of the Prettiest
566312630.author: a TripAdvisor user
566312630.reviewBody: The center of every Mexican town is the Zocalo or main plaza, often uninspiring.  This is a very classy town and this one is one of my top ten having visited hundreds of communities over the years.  Surrounded with boutiques, art and fine hotels and dining, the mood is enhanced by the absence of motorized vehicles, as this is a pedestrian only place.  Quite a luxury in Mexico.  Easy to sit for hours in the garden like space drinking in the tranquility and ambience, people watching and as the Buddhists say "eating the air."  I could do without the little tourist toy train that circles about.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

555702847.name: Great start to a day trip
555702847.author: a TripAdvisor user
555702847.reviewBody:
We arrived early in Tequis on our day trip, enroute from San Miguel. To start things off right, we had a quick breakfast at one of the better restaurants around the plaza. 
There are lots to choose from. Then we spent most of the morning browsing thru the stores – lots of fun and exciting things to see and buy.  

Off the plaza there are also some handicraft markets, and we ended up taking the trolley bus around the town to take in the sites quickly.  That included some wine and cheese tastings at a stop off point.  

Each year Tequis has a nice wine and cheese festival, and we have come in the past, as well as visited some of the local vineyards that have events at that time. 

Just after 1 pm we headed off to see the big rock in Bernal.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

548748505.name: Nice particularly at sunset
548748505.author: a TripAdvisor user
548748505.reviewBody: Nice square with restaurants and shops. Church bells dominate on the hour. At sunset hundreds of grackle birds do a murmuration and roost in the trees in the square.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

542622158.name: Hang out with any kind of food
542622158.author: a TripAdvisor user
542622158.reviewBody: We never walked to town without passing by and stopping for some sight or event. From the church to the parade we saw to the marching band to the demonstration to the milkshakes!

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

534162614.name: Hubbub of Activity!
534162614.author: a TripAdvisor user
534162614.reviewBody: There is always something going on in this plaza.  It is like a beehive of activity. In the week we were there, there was a Singing Competition, a play, a band, a guy dressed up as a skeleton monk, along with vendors of all kinds.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

533560001.name: Historic
533560001.author: a TripAdvisor user
533560001.reviewBody: Very interesting, oldest plaza in the city. Quaint, charming, quiet in an older part of town. Beautiful very old church on this plaza. We stayed in a chalet a few blocks away.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

516697296.name: Easy way to kill a few hours
516697296.author: a TripAdvisor user
516697296.reviewBody:
Plaza Miguel Hidalgo was an adorable "town square" filled with abundant photo opportunities, shops, and delicious restaurants to casually browse through. There are a few beautiful churches either right on the square or near by for you to explore as well. In the middle of the square, there are large "TEQUIS" letters that are great for selfies and group photos. 

TIP: Don't stick to just the square! The plaza has a lot of smaller avenue branching off of it with adorable, quiant side streets filled with restaurants and shops!

TIP #2: Only go during the day if  you are a more nervous traveller. We went to the square during the night to get a late-night dinner. We stopped at the TEQUIS block letters to take photos while some school children were hanging out near by. As soon as we were done taking a photos, one of the little girls (7-9 years old) immediately ran up and (in spanish) said that we had to pay for the photos we took. It was a little alarming, as we then noticed an older man standing back from the kids staring at them as if he was watching over them. Luckily, we were traveling with a couple from Mexico that just shook the girl off, but it did make me a little concerned what would have happened if we weren't with the couple from Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

505117101.name: TX is not Texas
505117101.author: a TripAdvisor user
505117101.reviewBody: TX stands for Te-Equis or Tequis. Short for Tequisquiapan. Adorable town with lots of artisian food, especially cheese and wine. Shopping is great too.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

489251239.name: A very nice place to see all the little shops and cafes.
489251239.author: a TripAdvisor user
489251239.reviewBody: A great little place to explore, with fantastic fondas (homes/cafes) along the way to experiment at. Lots of shops and places to eat. We went during the food and wine festival which made it much more crowded but very festive.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

486498008.name: Colourful and peaceful
486498008.author: a TripAdvisor user
486498008.reviewBody: I loved the pastel colours we were surrounded by. There was a general peaceful feeling, which was awesome as we were coming from the craziness of Mexico DF. Totally recommend!

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

475629019.name: Plaza Hidalgo
475629019.author: a TripAdvisor user
475629019.reviewBody: Great place to visit. Lots of artesan\u00edas. Good prices. Very happy place. Lots of good people ready to help

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

475385708.name: A beautiful place to walk and see
475385708.author: a TripAdvisor user
475385708.reviewBody: This small plaza is an authentic jewel of the town, right in the central point of the national territory, it doesn\'t matter if is crowded like in holy days (eastern in M\u00e9xico) or if is quiet like in non holidays you will always can find a place to sit in the plaza. There are regional candy sellers and other treats you can eat while take a rest of a sunny day or long walk in town.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

468637059.name: A great place for a stroll
468637059.author: a TripAdvisor user
468637059.reviewBody: The Plaza is the colorful center of the town of Tequis.  It is surrounded by shops, restaurants, and a variety of craftspeople selling their wares.  It seems there is always some sort of music playing, whether on the square itself or from one of the bordering restaurants.  Definitely a place to spend some time relaxing.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

465899063.name: Not To Be Missed: Charming and SO Clean!
465899063.author: a TripAdvisor user
465899063.reviewBody: Can anyone come to Tequis and not visit the main plaza?  This is the heart of Tequis centro.  A beautiful place with many shops and restaurants surrounding the very impressive church. So many other places to visit are an easy walk from here..the mercado..the artisans mercado..Find the tourism center right on the square to get a wonderful map for free.  \nThe pride of the natives and municipal government of Tequisquiapan is clearly witnessed here!  Sit a spell...take in the beautiful charm and feel blessed to have found this place.  Very, very safe, even for solo travelers!

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

464996046.name: The heart of Tequis
464996046.author: a TripAdvisor user
464996046.reviewBody: A charming colonial plaza, with a central garden a beautiful kiosk and surrounded by archways, shops and restaurants.  Late in the afternoon enjoy watching the birds returning for the night (5:30-6:30pm).

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

454624906.name: Hang out
454624906.author: a TripAdvisor user
454624906.reviewBody: This is a typical Mexican square colofrul, and just window shopping is great.  There are lots of restaurants around it.  Didn\'t eat there but I am sure they are all great.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

451269337.name: Nice, open plaza
451269337.author: a TripAdvisor user
451269337.reviewBody: We visited in January and walked from your hotel about 10 minutes away to browse the stores and get some dessert. Some had ice cream but I\'d recommend getting a churro at the cart just outside the main square. \n\nHad lunch at a restaurant the day before. Don\'t let kids with digital cameras take your photo unless you want to later be urged to buy an empty bottle with your photo on it.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

448164557.name: Very pleasant
448164557.author: a TripAdvisor user
448164557.reviewBody: It has many stores and restaurants. Very colonial and picturesque. \n\nIf you are in Tequis, you can\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

445858839.name: Our hometown centro
445858839.author: a TripAdvisor user
445858839.reviewBody: Beautiful place to spend some relaxing time, lots of good seating, can get your shoes shines, ride on a kid\'s train, visit a variety of shops and restaurant, lots of friendly people to mix with and a very good bilingual tourist office

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

440759755.name: In the center of the city
440759755.author: a TripAdvisor user
440759755.reviewBody: A place surrounded by restaurants and small stores. Good to spend some time. You can move from here to the attractions of the town.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

435091761.name: Pretty little town
435091761.author: a TripAdvisor user
435091761.reviewBody: Pretty town center with lots of nice shops. Also nice to sit and people watch. There is a nice Artisan market just off the center. We all enjoyed it.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

432386205.name: Charming Square
432386205.author: a TripAdvisor user
432386205.reviewBody: A Magic Town of Mexico and its central plaza is its nicely maintained gem surrounded by artisan shops and cafes. The streets around the plaza are pedestrian only and a joy to walk.  The plaza is as nice as they get and a fine testament to its inclusion in the Magic Town program.  Our day visit to Tequis gave us the desire for a longer visit.  The city has many fine hotels in Centro.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

397093421.name: I love the plaza.
397093421.author: a TripAdvisor user
397093421.reviewBody: Lovely place to just sit and people watch.  Many people seem to bring their dogs with them to stroll around or sit and chat.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

395177599.name: Is a must visit!
395177599.author: a TripAdvisor user
395177599.reviewBody:
Very nice place I loved this plaza, you can walk around in a very nice environment where children are playing around, people sit on the benches to contemplate the main fountain or see the colourful train passing by with kids that wave from the inside.

I think is the main church of the town the one that is located in that plaza, is lovely you have to visit it. 

You can't miss it, is like the centre of life of Tequisquiapan surrounded by restaurants, coffee shops, stores. 

Peaceful place.

While we were walking around, we had the chance to listen to a rock band that was playing they music gathering the people who passed by to listen to them for that matter I believe is the people's place.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

394841548.name: Nice for outdoor walking
394841548.author: a TripAdvisor user
394841548.reviewBody: It is a small plaza, you may walk, relax, have a nice outdoor time, you will find restaurants, bars, shopping, the main church, plenty of room for kids to play!

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

390985038.name: Wonderful place .. U must goooo
390985038.author: a TripAdvisor user
390985038.reviewBody: This is a very nice Historical Center in Tequis... Around the place u will find many nice restaurants and nice things to buy\n\nU will definitely love this place, u can actually stay in a beautiful hotels around here and take a tour to the vinedos.. I would say that this is my second prefer place after Puebla

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

378460429.name: Nice afternoon
378460429.author: a TripAdvisor user
378460429.reviewBody: We arrive to Tequisquiapan after a morning in La Pe\u00f1a de Bernal.\nWe shopped a little bit and then spend some time at the plaza.\nNice, serene place.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

362141829.name: Very nice place
362141829.author: a TripAdvisor user
362141829.reviewBody: The plaza has a lot of restaurants where you can eat and it has a very nice church.\nIt is in good conditions and you can spend a very nice time walking around or just sitting and relaxing on a bench.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

357808164.name: Charming Mexican plaza
357808164.author: a TripAdvisor user
357808164.reviewBody:
Even though it is not the best plaza that you'll find in Mexican towns, it has all the the ingredients to be a nice place to have a walk around.

The church in the center of it has the image of the virgin, like many other towns, but it is always great to take pictures of it. Besides, the town has flea markets during the weekends with artisan things made from the locals. 

Therefore, if you're driving around Tequisquiapan it's worth it to stop for a while and have a walk around

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

307343874.name: Excelent
307343874.author: a TripAdvisor user
307343874.reviewBody: It\'s a very nice place, very spacious and with lots of restaurants and stores. The streets around the plaza are colonial and I recommend a walk. Maybe you won\'t be able to find things day after day as it is not very big, but it\'s a great place to visit for 1 or 2 days of rest. It\'s very tranquil and the climate was great when I got there. \n\nThere\'s a market of traditional crafts close by.

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

274997794.name: Plaza revisited
274997794.author: a TripAdvisor user
274997794.reviewBody: Mostly comercial spots full of tourists and shoppers. Not a parking space nearby. \nVery noisy y and smelly because of sewage pipes underneath

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

236813479.name: Must see in Tequisquiapan, Queretaro
236813479.author: a TripAdvisor user
236813479.reviewBody: This is the main place to visit while in Tequisquiapan... you man not only visit the main Church Templo de Santa Maria de la Asunci\u00f3n, but will find hand crafts, stores, galleries, restaurants, bars and a place where you can stay for hours alone, with family or friends. \n\nWas renovated in 2014, and you will see clean sidewalks, beautiful archs, fountain, gardens... love this place!

address.streetAddress: Entre las calles Independencia y Morelos

566310679.name: Nice Place for a Sit
566310679.author: a TripAdvisor user
566310679.reviewBody: For a town park in Mexico it is very green and clean, in character with the type of town this is.  Still it is just a park, nice to take a cool drink and read a book, tranquil and quiet.  I went on a weekday afternoon so I was practically alone and nothing was happening.  Like everywhere else here it probably jumps on weekends.

address.streetAddress: Av. Ezequiel Montes s/n Centro

542622698.name: Park near the center.
542622698.author: a TripAdvisor user
542622698.reviewBody: This is a lovely park adjacent to the historial section where many different types of events are held.  Lots of beautiful old trees and a small creek.  Not a lot of "facilities" available.  Parking right near the entrance.

address.streetAddress: Av. Ezequiel Montes s/n Centro

440759476.name: Just a park
440759476.author: a TripAdvisor user
440759476.reviewBody: Nothing interesting to see unless you have children\'s that want to play or just sit in a bench to see around.

address.streetAddress: Av. Ezequiel Montes s/n Centro

439350037.name: Siesta Time!
439350037.author: a TripAdvisor user
439350037.reviewBody: The park is walking distance from the artisan market and across the street from el Centro Cultural. The park is spacious and it is ideal place for you to plop down and read a book. It is a good place to visit if you have children. The park consists of a playground and a water canal. It is lined with trees that provide great shade for an afternoon nap. There is a snack stand available on the premises.

address.streetAddress: Av. Ezequiel Montes s/n Centro

655886920.name: Great Place, great food, great fun
655886920.author: a TripAdvisor user
655886920.reviewBody: Spent the day at Hacienda el Sue\u00f1o with my two kids (7 & 5). It is a great scenario. Good food with outstanding craft beer. A must stop when near Tequis or Queretaro. Petting farm was great as well. Staff is extremely attentive. \n\nHighly recommended spot to have lunch or spend the day.

address.streetAddress: Highway Tequisquiapan-Queretaro Km 50.2
